column2: MASSACHUSETTS DMV DRIVING TEST
Question Text
1. On slippery roads, drivers should:
column4: increase their speed to avoid hydroplaning.

column2: 2. Examples of proper glass maintenance include:
column4: Keeping your windows clean and clear.
column6: Making sure there is enough windshield fluid in the reservoir.

column2: 3. When driving on wet roads, you should remember:
column4: you should give yourself additional time to stop.
column6: to stay farther behind the vehicle ahead of you.
column8: driving on wet roads can cause hydroplaning.

5. If your car starts to skid, turn your steering wheel:
column4: in any direction. It doesnt matter.
column6: in the direction you want to go.
column8: in the opposite direction of the skid.
column10: to keep the front wheels straight.

column2: 6. Your blind spot is the area of the road:
column4: you see in your side mirror.
column8: you cannot see without moving your head.
column10: you see in your rearview mirror.

column2: 7. BAC is:
column4: the number of ounces of alcohol in your blood.
column8: the amount of alcohol in your body.
column10: the percentage of alcohol in your blood.

column2: 8. When meeting a car with blinding headlights, you should:
column4: look toward the left side of the road.
column6: use your emergency flashers to warn the other driver.
column8: look toward the right side of the road.
column10: dim your lights, then speed up and pass quickly.

column2: 9. Drivers can not pass a vehicle on the left if:
column4: they approach the top of a hill on a two-way road and can not see over it.
column6: they are within 100 feet of a railroad crossing on a two-way roadway.
column8: they can not safely return to the right lane before they reach a solid yellow center line for the right lane.

column2: 10. This road sign means:
column4: Sharp left turns ahead, in both directions.
column6: The center lane in both directions of travel will soon turn left.
column8: Vehicles may only travel in the center lane.
column10: The center lane is shared for left turns in both directions of travel.

12. If a vehicle using high beams comes toward you, look towards __________ of the road.
13. As you approach an intersection, the traffic light changes from green to yellow. You should:
column4: apply the brakes sharply and come to a complete stop.
column6: be prepared to stop in the middle of the intersection.
column8: speed up to beat the red light.
column10: be prepared to stop before the intersection.

column2: 14. Service signs are ____ with ____ letters and symbols.

16. Drivers may cross solid yellow lines:
column6: only to pass traffic moving in the same direction.

column2: 17. What is the meaning of orange traffic signs?
column6: Stop, do not enter or wrong way.
column10: Warning of school, pedestrian, and bicycling activity.

column2: 18. When making a turn, drivers must _____ their speed.
19. This sign tells drivers that:
column6: there is a right turn ahead.
column8: they must stay on the right side of the divider
column10: there is a reduction of lanes ahead.

column2: 20. It is important for drivers to know that trucks:
column4: take longer than cars to stop.
column6: require less time to pass on an incline than cars.
column8: require more space for turning movements.
column10: are easier for the driver to operate.

column2: 21. Where there is no bicycle lane, where on the road must a bicyclist ride?
column4: on the left shoulder of the road.
column6: near the left edge of the road.
column8: near the right curb or edge of the road.

column2: 22. The first sign drivers see when approaching a highway-rail intersection is usually:
23. When the road is slippery, you should:
column8: use your emergency or parking brake.
column10: press your brakes in slow, steady strokes.

column2: 24. What should you do in case of a steering failure?
column4: Pump your gas pedal a few times to increase the pressure.
column6: Don't panic. Turn on your emergency lights to let other drivers know you are having car problems. Move toward the side of the road and bring the car to a gradual stop.
